caption: Nice and small gallery. Full of surprises and great experiences. You don't need more than 2 hours to complete the visit (1 hour if you can read french). The only negative aspect I could find was the lack of English translations on the majority of the items displayed, otherwise a great experience.
If you are interested in science, it is a place you will like very much. You can see many large and small crystals.

This museum was more interesting than I expected it to be. There are really big crystals and a great variety of smaller ones and lots of information on them, how they are formed etc. There‚Äôs also a section on meteorites. Not very big but definitely big enough. I went on a weekday and it wasn‚Äôt crowded. Information given was in french but worth visiting if you don‚Äôt speak French to look at the minerals and gems, some very rare.

The collection of stones is magnificent.  This museum is made up of several thematic spaces (their classification, the large stones, the colors, the shapes, the stones of meteorites, etc.) which present the most beautiful stones and their diversity.  The presentation is of high quality with written explanations and videos.  The classification of stones is presented.  The geology and evolution of the earth is not presented.  The museum is playful and we saw the smile of the children in front of the spectacle of these stones.  It usually takes 1 hour to visit this museum.  We took 2 hours.  Excellent. Weak point. They do not care about the diversity of their customers, that include foreigners, and would not contribute to France‚Äôs influence abroad: All is in French. I give a 4 instead of a 5 stars [I'm French]

Quite an interesting museum, but I was expecting it to be bigger. All in all, it's just one big hall. You can see different minerals, unfortunately, mostly no labels/descriptions in English. Personally, I prefer the anthropology museum at Jardin des planted
The fine examples of Tourmaline, beryls, and topaz were some of the best in Paris!

I'm so happy I went here because all of the pieces are truly stunning. The variety is great and I was amazed by every single piece. There are raw stones, polished stones and artworks made of minerals/crystals, everything! It's also quite cheap and for me it was even free because I am under 26. I would definitely recommend this to everyone!

I love rocks and this museum had an excellent collection of rocks and minerals. All exhibits were in French, so bring your Google translate if you‚Äôre not fluent in french. Took one star off because it was a lot smaller than expected, but the quality of specimens and exhibits were excellent! No need to reserve a ticket ahead of time, as it‚Äôs not the most popular museum in Paris. Don‚Äôt miss it if you love rocks too :)

Fantastic collection of minerals, esp the quartz and rare stones. Also some gem stones and other art pieces.  Only downside was that the text is in French only. I used Google Translate which worked fine.

LOVED this gallery! I'm a geology student and I had a great time here. Got in for free as a student. The exhibit was small but the mineral and rock samples they had were spectacular. The labels are in French, if you don't speak the language. Not busy at all when I went on a Wednesday.

Located within a Jardin de plants in 5th arrondissement, Metro Jussieu 7 and 10. The gallery displays a collection of crystals gemstones and minerals, amongst the best in the world. The collection began in 1625. You won‚Äôt disappointed. Highly recommend.

This is a difficult one . . . . The mineral collection is amazing, and beautifully presented.  But there are no rocks, no "geology".  What is in the rest of the building?  Is it just closed?  Seems a shame that there is no geology on show, given France's rich geological heritage.  Also a shame that there were no volunteers on hand to discuss and enthuse.  Just one officious jerk of a security guy with a very limited script, who objected to me, a professional geologist, pointing at the crystals, to explain things to my wife.
Small but impressive collection, from tiny carved gems to huge quartz boulders! Next to gorgeous gardens to wander in too.

One room with very large crystals (up to 3000 kg). There are 8 small side rooms with a good collection of various minerals and precious stones. We stayed for maybe 45 minutes. Most of the descriptions were in French. Overall a good collection though limited.

Rich history whichever of the three buildings you visit, the quality of the exposed "material" is superb, you travel through time by going through extinct species. We went for the T-Rex expo and it was magnificient sight of one of earth greatest predators!
A gallery worth visit despite much smaller than The Mus√©e de Min√©ralogie.  I have never seen such large crystals
Unique exhibition with a great assortment of specimens to look at. Would have enjoyed it even more if there were explanations in English.

Such a gorgeous museum. Cheap price and brilliant selection of different minerals which only make for a splendid experience for passionates as well as newbies. A marvelous place indeed thank you so much !
There was not a single thing in English i.e. any non French visitor is doomed to either spectate or use the google app to translate.

Small gallery, one floor. Took us about 45mins to do the full tour and reading all the material and observing all the stuff. For the 7‚Ç¨ price it‚Äôs worth it and very cool and nice and enlightening. Will be back
A small but impressive showcase. A nice addition to the other museums around the gardens but not worth a visit on its own.
Very beautiful exhibition over there

Incredible collection of gigantic crystals and minerals from all over the world. Many coming from Minas Gerais, Brazil. If you have any interest in geology or stones, this is a must see! Plan on about 45 minutes for a pretty extensive visit.
Small museum, a bit expensive for such limited exposition... but very impressive and colorful collection.

The historical space is magnificent, with important collections from various parts of the world. Nevertheless the bad reputation of the Parisians was confirmed by the rude and unfriendly attendance of the employees of the Museum who do not know the value of a simple smile. Historically, they have stolen the treasures of Brazil and now charge tourists from all over the world, including educators to appreciate the stolen treasures and still charge dearly to appreciate what was stolen us, minerals, plants and animals from our Brazil
username: No campo com Z√© Siqueira (No campo com Z√©)

caption: On the positive side the rocks and minerals in the museum are well chosen, organized, and truly impressive. Especially the giant ones near the entrance. On the negative side this museum is really just one room, so it is much smaller than I thought and than is expected given the entry price. All signs are in French only so for foreigners there is really just the beauty of the rocks to take in and nothing much to learn. The explanatory panels that are there are very text heavy - even the digital ones and could not get my kids excited. In general the museum does not make any effort to cater to kids. There is nothing to touch, nothing to help them see the rocks higher up, no panels to explain phenomena in kids friendly terms or that put things in relation to what kids know or understand. I rated the museum still high because it is modern and the rocks/minerals are impressive but I did take a point off for lack of effort to fulfill the museum's mission to educate.
Very interesting collection. Unfortunately the explanations are very scarce. More videos and or guidance for non-geologists would have been welcome

It's a nice but rather small collection of gemstones and minerals. The entrance fee of 8‚Ç¨ is not really worth it in my opinion. Also the staff was very grumpy and a little rude, so all in all Not a recommendation, sorry!
Beautiful stones but I expected more. It is small and the text is in Frech so I didn't understand the history of it.
Terribly disappointing what appears to be a massive building you only get to go in the room about the size of a 7-Eleven and they charge you nine euros for that
I never thought there would be so many cool things to be seen there!
Beautiful contemplative experience, and also very interesting expo of one the oldest mineral collection in the world
Minerals üåç unbelievable things in earth - worth it to visit this museum - collections from 1625 - Founded in 1635 by king Louis XIII. ‚Ä¶
Went for the T-Rex expo. The skeleton is impressive but the expo is very short and was overcrowded. 14 euros is really too much for the experience.
I only missed translations. The gallery is small but is really entertaining.
Smallish but absolutely incredible collection

7‚Ç¨ per adult for one very small wing of the building with about 12 C-shaped small sections displaying rocks and minerals and a central area with large specimens, many from Brazil.  Quiet, clean, but very small and not interactive.  You'll get more out of going to a rock and mineral show.

It is small but has some really cool rocks and minerals to look at. It is only in French. Not much explanation behind certain things but it‚Äôs more fun to just admire the natural beauty. The front desk person wasn‚Äôt the kindest ..  If you visited a different museum you can give them the ticket to save $2
Nice tidy museum if you are interested in minerals and stuff.

This place rocks! It's not a massive place (it probably only took 20-30 minutes to get through), but some awesome specimens and information. Turns out I didn't have to buy a ticket, so verify whether or not you need to ahead of time.
Nice museum
It is a lot smaller than expected, but with the ability to enter for free as an EU citizen under 26, it is still really worth it. Sadly, there is not much information in English available.

They have a wide variety of different stones and minerals. They are truly beautiful, the only downside of the gallery is that everything is in French. So I think the only possible improvement is adding more languages. But it's definitely worth going here.
"It is only rocks... is that ok for you?"
Went because wife. Wife like = 5 stars.
This was a pleasant surprise. For those who want a peaceful and introspective museum visit, this is one of the best places in Paris.
Excellent virtual expo for Mondes disparus.muat visit. Worth the entry price of 29 eur/pers
Wide collection of rocks with highlights of their special properties. My only wish is if they included more info about each rock (chemical composition, uses, history of discovery)
